title: Keen Dreams: How good do you think it is?
content:
I thought it was about time for a new poll, so I'm going with a fairly standard question that's probably been made a poll at least 49,494,499,333 times in the history of this forum.

Feel free to strangle me, but first you must answer me this question one: what are your thoughts on Keen Dreams? Where does it stand in relation to the other Keen games?

Hopefully the poll choices are adequate, I'm not sure if five is really enough or if I've given the right options. I'm playing Keen Dreams now (sort of), so I'll post my thoughts and/or answer the poll a bit later.------------------
[url=http://www.ericmushroomwilson.co.uk/] My website[/url]
[url=http://ericmushroom.livejournal.com/]My stupid journal thing[/url]

title: Re: Keen Dreams: How good do you think it is?
content:
I said 'It's good, but not as good as the others'

(Presuming 'Others' does not include GBC Keen.)

---Freeyorp

title: lol
content:
I can't believe the options are so biased! I personally think that Vorticons is better than Galaxy, though Dreams still ranks below both.

It's a cute game, but it shows that it is a contracted game, rather than a complete realization of an idea.

title: Re: lol
content:
Good, but not good as others. Yeah, like Xky said, there's something missing. And it's annoying it has that bug where one can jump to death tiles and not get killed if one presses and holds the jump key again when landing.3D Realms: "Do you think there'll ever be a sequel to your game(s)?"
Tom Hall: "If I owned Keen, there sure would be. I don't consider that GBA game canon by any means."

title: Re: lol
content:
Either way, the way a poll is phrased can have an important impact on the outcome; a question could ask whether you think the police should be able to secure public safety by collecting information on terrorist organizations. or whether they should be allowed to spy on people and record personal detail without their permission.

Likewise, this is a very negative poll saying, briefly 'KeenDreams sucks, or maybe it aint so bad, what do you think?'
[img]http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v499/Nevad/menbun.gif[/img]

Cute bunny!

title: Re: Keen Dreams: How good do you think it is?
content:
I chose other.

I could say "BAD", but I'm not saying that because it's still a good game, but not the kind of game you would expect in the Commander Keen series. For example, some graphics are IDENTICAL to Keen 4 graphics (rocky ground, etc.), there's no pogo and you can't "shoot" your opponents. You throw things at them instead, and the effect is temporary. That was disappointing for me the first time I played it. There are some cool discoveries in its engine, though. For example, you see the "loading level" progress bar in Bio Menace too, and the main menu has some sort of different layout. Impressing mouse cursor, btw. Kee4-6 and Bio Menace had mouse support, but none of them displayed an actual mouse cursor like Keen Dreams did. The engine is very similar to Keen4's, except for the worldmap functionality. The "this area is for entering level X" spots are hardcoded in the engine (I mean, they are predefined info-plane values that can't be modified except by patching the binary, while in Keen4-6 you could write the info-plane values for each level entrance directly, and they weren't restricted to predefined info-plane values/sprites).
(message cutted to half. word count maximum exceeded)------------------
SM: "I could go and write a page about the Theory of Relativity (or whatever it's called), but, what is the point if I don't know what the Theory of Relativity is?"

[url=http://shadowm2006.sitesled.com/]My website[/url]

title: Re: Keen Dreams: How good do you think it is?
content:
It's good, but not as good as the others. Keen 1-3 had smoother gameplay, and Keen 4-6 just had the big advantages of a gun and pogo, which I really miss in Dreams.____________
Don't think of me as an ordinary man.

title: Re: Keen Dreams: How good do you think it is?
content: It has its moments, but I don't like it very much at all. I think the only Keen game I would rank it above would be Keen 3, which I utterly loathed.[center]<font color="MAROON">TOUGH GUYS DON'T FOLLOW FADS</font>[/center]
